refnamediv.refpurpose: FTP put command; Virtuoso FTP client

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Virtuoso has FTP client functionality, that can be used inside Virtuoso/PL. This Virtuoso function mimics the FTP put command. As with any PL, this can be combined with Web Services and SOAP.

refsect2.title: server
refsect2.para: The remote server address or IP Address.

refsect2.title: user
refsect2.para: The username for authentication at the FTP server.

refsect2.title: pass
refsect2.para: The accompanying password for authentication at the FTP server.

refsect2.title: local_file_name
refsect2.para: The full path and file name of the local file to be uploaded. This is relative to the server root directory. This directory must be included in DirsAllowed ACL list in the Virtuoso.INI file.

refsect2.title: remote_file_name
refsect2.para: Full path and file name to the file on the FTP server to be uploaded.

refsect2.title: is_pasv
refsect2.para: Flag to specify whether to use passive mode. This can be one "1" for passive mode, or zero "0" for active mode. One "1" is assumed by default.

refsect1.title: Return Types
refsect1.para: This function returns either 1 for success, or the error returned from the server.

refsect1.title: Errors
refsect1.para: This function will return any errors returned by the remote FTP server.
